2_1EZTWytasXcKdiUFnN4KHqAfvg1nwkTkKv.body: Each site is its own node. As long as you keep seeding (uploading to others who visit) it will have at least one node. The more visitors (who seed),  the more nodes (+1). Correct me if i am wrong.

> [kai0](#comment_3_1EZTWytasXcKdiUFnN4KHqAfvg1nwkTkKv): what you talk is not about the Q: Can my blog connect to the zerohello node?

I did answer your Q, it is not possible to have your blog connect to the zerohello node. If you read what I wrote, you'd know.

1_1CzbtDCC8LsC47ryNJmdVNcMLBwyHBDGS3.body: I don't think there is currently any videos that are disturbing in zer0net. However, if you are using tor, you'd find plenty over in onionland. Still want links?

> [hero1](#comment_2_1PyBb9EesSEne4wiS3sUKDbTueS1wKPrrG): anyone know any links to some good torrent sites for college books in the DW?

Try tpb (The Pirate Bay).  http://uj3wazyk5u4hnvtk.onion/

> [hero1](#comment_2_1PyBb9EesSEne4wiS3sUKDbTueS1wKPrrG): anyone know any links to some good torrent sites for college books in the DW?

You might find it easier to look on the clearnet for college books. There was a site dedicated to sharing all screened/copied books, available for download. I don't remember the name.
I found a similar site on clearnet: https://openlibrary.org/
